page.title: 07Shops
page.content: There are 2 shops in Studham village. "Maisies" is about 200 years old and has always sold a variety of goods. Today Maisies sells sweets, tobacco, toys and newspapers. "Studham Stores and Post Office" is opposite Maisies and sells a range of food products. It is one of the oldest buildings in Studham and still has the well where the village people used to come for their water. It was also the village bakehouse and has a large bread oven at the back. The shops are well used and are an important focus for the village. Barwythe Hall rebuilt and enlarged in 1849 was originally the Manor House but in 1977 became the offices of Bierrum's a company which designs and builds industrial chimneys for home and overseas markets.
